dc:description: The relationship between PEX5 and autosomal recessive peroxisome biogenesis disorder was first reported in 1995, (Dodt et al., PMID:7719337). Evidence supporting this gene-disease relationship includes case-level data and experimental data. Summary of case-level and experimental data: 12.5 points. There are five patients reported in the literature with variants (nonsense, frameshift, and missense) (PMID: 26220973, PMID: 7719337, PMID: 27290639). This gene-disease association is supported by in vitro functional assays and animal models. Per criteria outlined by the ClinGen Lumping and Splitting Working Group, we found no difference in molecular mechanism(s), inheritance pattern, and phenotypic variability underlying the disease entities: (1) Peroxisome biogenesis disorder 2A (MIM: 214110), (2) Peroxisome biogenesis disorder 2B (MIM: 202370), and (3) Rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata, type 5 (MIM: 616716). Therefore, all of the disease entities have been lumped into one disease entity, Peroxisome Biogenesis Disorder. In summary, PEX5 is definitively associated with autosomal recessive peroxisomal biogenesis disorder. This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both the research and clinical diagnostic settings and has been upheld over time.

evidence.dc:description: Pxr1-/- weighed less than WT and heterozygous mice (Figs. 1e, 2a), most null mice died before 72hrs, they had no evidence of renal cysts, intrauterine growth retardation (Fig. 2a) possibly due to defective insulin-like growth factor responsiveness, absence of peroxisomes (Fig. 3b), catalase immunoreactivity detected only in cytoplasm of hepatocytes and fibroblasts (Figs. 3e, 4c,d), DHAPAT activity was not detected in liver or brain homogenates of null mice and there was depletion of plasmalogens in these same tissues (Table 1), null mice showed six- to tenfold increase in VLCFA levels compared to heterozygotes and WT mice (Table 1), ultrastructural analysis of liver and kidneys from Prx1-/- mice showed abnormal mitochondrial structure, autophagic vacuoles with peroxisomal proteins, lipid accumulation, and increased macrophages (Fig. 5), Prx1 -/- mice had abnormal neocortical development due to defects in neuronal migration, differentiation, and cell survival (Fig. 6)
evidence.rdfs:label: Zellweger Mouse Model

evidence.dc:description: absence of peroxisomes identified via histochemical staining for catalase in hepatocytes (Fig. 1B), aggregates of pleomorphic mitochondria throughout liver on basolateral surfaces of hepatocytes (Fig. 1B), electron microscopy showed mitochondrial alterations involving all subcompartments (Fig. 1B-J), mitochondrial alterations were also found in epithelial cells of the adrenal cortex, proximal tubules of kidneys, cardiomyocytes, skeletal muscle, neutrophils, and lymphocytes (Fig. 2), newborn null mice had decreased activity of complexes I and V or mitochondrial respiratory chain in liver (table 1, fig. 3), respiratory chain alterations led to oxidative stress in liver mitochondria evidenced by in situ hybridization and immunocytochemical analysis (Fig. 6)
evidence.rdfs:label: PEX5 knockout

evidence.dc:description: Impaired PTS1 and PTS2 protein import, impaired b-oxidation, VLCFA accumulation
evidence.rdfs:label: PEX5-deficient fibroblasts

evidence.dc:description: yeast two-hybrid system detected interaction between PEX12 zinc-binding domain and PEX5 (Fig. 2A), protein budding assay which confirmed PEX5-PEX12 binding by showing PEX5 bound byMBP-PEX12 and not MBP-LacZalpha (Fig. 2B), coimmunopreciptation revealed that PEX5 precipitated with PEX12/3xmyc in lysates from human fibroblasts (Fig. 2C)
evidence.rdfs:label: PEX12 Interaction

evidence.dc:description:
Variant results in frameshift p.Val242Glyfs, Variant absent in gnomAD

Variant evidence: immunoblot analysis detected two bands for PEX5L and PEX5S isoforms in control fibroblats, but only one band was present in patient's fibroblasts correlating to presence of only PEX5S, thus variant results in loss of PEX5L isoform (Fig. 3)

evidence.rdfs:label: FB II-1
evidence.detectionMethod: WES, variant and homozygosity confirmed with Sanger Sequencing
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata, normal birth weight and OFC, height and OFC were both below the 0.4th percentile and weight was 25th percentile at 6.5yo

evidence.dc:description:
Variant results in frameshift p.Val242Glyfs, variant absent from gnomAD

Variant Evidence: immunoblot analysis detected two bands for PEX5L and PEX5S isoforms in control fibroblats, but only one band was present in patient's fibroblasts correlating to presence of only PEX5S, thus variant results in loss of PEX5L isoform (Fig. 3)

evidence.rdfs:label: FA II-1
evidence.detectionMethod: WES, variant and homozygosity confirmed with Sanger Sequencing
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: rhizomelic chrondrodysplasia punctata, born at term, normal growth parameters, normal hearing, short pedicles, able to walk, PTS2 protein import defect, VLCFAs: C26 = 0.92, pristanic acid = 1010, plasmalogens: C16 DMA/C16 : 0 = 2.2, C18 : 0 DMA/C18 : 0 =7.2, GNPAT activity = 3.8nmol, PLA = 427 umol/l, alpha-oxidation = 7pmol

evidence.dc:description:
Score reduced due to lack of phenotypic evidence for proband and lack of functional evidence for variants

n.2155C>T - reported in paper and Allele registry as c.1669C>T (p.Arg549Trp), reported to be maternally inherited, gnomAD frequency = 0.00001193

p.Ser600Leu reported to be paternally inherited, absent from gnomAD

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 20
evidence.detectionMethod: DNA isolated from fibroblasts, WES, variants confirmed via Sanger sequencing, parents tested
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: patients suspected to have mitochondrial disorder, Study inclusion criteria (fulfill at least 1): neonatal onset, basal ganglia involvement, increased 3-MGA in urine

evidence.dc:description:
Variant absent from gnomAD

Variant Evidence: SV40-transformed fibroblast cell line (0051) derived from skin fibroblasts of patient transfected with vector (pcDNA3) or WT PEX5 expression vector, expression of WT PEX5 restored PTS1 protein import while those cells with just vector did not have this activity restored (Fig. 7), 

PMID:9668159: transfection of patients cells with PEX5s restores only PTS1-mediated protein transport, transfection with PEX5L restores both PTS1 and PTS2-mediated protein transport

evidence.rdfs:label: PBD005
evidence.detectionMethod: RT-PCR of cDNA, sequence analysis, variant confirmed by PCR and sequence analysis
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: neonatal adrenoleukodystrophy, defect of PTS1- and PTS2-mediated uptake of peroxisomal proteins

evidence.dc:description:
Variant absent from gnomad

Variant Evidence: 018T SV 40-transformed cells (derivative of skin fibroblast cells from patient) were transfected with plasmids expressing the WT PEX5, p.Asn526Lys variant, and PAF1, cells were examined by immunofluorescence microscopy with anti-Ser-Lys-Leu-COOH antibody. Cells were not able to import PTS1-containing proteins but did import PTS2 marker protein. Transfection of WT Pex5 into patient derived cell line showed restoration of normal PTS1-protein import into peroxisomes (Fig. 6d), and normal peroxisome morphology (fig. 6b)

evidence.rdfs:label: PBD018
evidence.detectionMethod: RT-PCR of RNA from patient's fibroblasts, then SSCP of PRX1 cDNA, variant confirmed via PCR and direct sequencing
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: neonatal adrenoleukodystrophy, defect of PTS1-mediated uptake of peroxisomal proteins
